pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:0.4.eng: The training rule having eight parts

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo avassutā avassutassa purisapuggalassa hatthaggahaṇampi sādiyanti, saṅghāṭikaṇṇaggahaṇampi sādiyanti, santiṭṭhantipi, sallapantipi, saṅketampi gacchanti, purisassapi abbhāgamanaṃ sādiyanti, channampi anupavisanti, kāyampi tadatthāya upasaṃharanti etassa asaddhammassa paṭisevanatthāya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:1.2.eng: At that time the nuns from the group of six, being lustful and aiming to indulge in inappropriate sexual conduct, consented to lustful men holding their hands and the edge of their robes, and they stood with them, chatted with them, went to rendezvous with them, consented to men coming to them, entered covered places with them, and disposed their bodies for that purpose.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:1.3.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:1.3.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo avassutā avassutassa purisapuggalassa hatthaggahaṇampi sādiyissanti, saṅghāṭikaṇṇaggahaṇampi sādiyissanti, santiṭṭhissantipi, sallapissantipi, saṅketampi gacchissanti, purisassapi abbhāgamanaṃ sādiyissanti, channampi anupavisissanti, kāyampi tadatthāya upasaṃharissanti etassa asaddhammassa paṭisevanatthāyā”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:1.4.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six do such things?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:1.5.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo avassutā avassutassa purisapuggalassa hatthaggahaṇampi sādiyanti, saṅghāṭikaṇṇaggahaṇampi sādiyanti, santiṭṭhantipi, sallapantipi, saṅketampi gacchanti, purisassapi abbhāgamanaṃ sādiyanti, channampi anupavisanti, kāyampi tadatthāya upasaṃharanti etassa asaddhammassa paṭisevanatthāyā”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:1.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do these things?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:1.8.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo avassutā avassutassa purisapuggalassa hatthaggahaṇampi sādiyissanti, saṅghāṭikaṇṇaggahaṇampi sādiyissanti, santiṭṭhissantipi, sallapissantipi, saṅketampi gacchissanti, purisassapi abbhāgamanaṃ sādiyissanti, channampi anupavisissanti, kāyampi tadatthāya upasaṃharissanti etassa asaddhammassa paṭisevanatthāya.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:1.8.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six, being lustful and aiming to indulge in inappropriate sexual conduct, consent to lustful men holding their hands and the edge of their robes, and how can they stand with them, chat with them, go to rendezvous with them, consent to men coming to them, enter covered places with them, and dispose their bodies for that purpose?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:1.10.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:1.10.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:1.11.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī avassutā avassutassa purisapuggalassa hatthaggahaṇaṃ vā sādiyeyya, saṅghāṭikaṇṇaggahaṇaṃ vā sādiyeyya, santiṭṭheyya vā, sallapeyya vā, saṅketaṃ vā gaccheyya, purisassa vā abbhāgamanaṃ sādiyeyya, channaṃ vā anupaviseyya, kāyaṃ vā tadatthāya upasaṃhareyya etassa asaddhammassa paṭisevanatthāya, ayampi pārājikā hoti asaṃvāsā aṭṭhavatthukā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:1.11.1.eng: ‘If, for the purpose of indulging in inappropriate sexual conduct, a lustful nun consents to a lustful man holding her hand and the edge of her robe, and she stands with him and chats with him and goes to a rendezvous with him and consents to him coming to her and enters a covered place with him and disposes her body for him for that purpose, she too is expelled and excluded from the community. The training rule having eight parts.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:1.11.1.comm: For a discussion of my rendering of vā as “and”, see Appendix on Individual Bhikkhunī Rules. For the rendering of saṅghāṭi as “robe”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.6.eng: having lust, longing for, in love with.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.8.eng: having lust, longing for, in love with.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.10.pli: manussapuriso, na yakkho na peto na tiracchānagato viññū paṭibalo kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjituṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.10.eng: a human male, not a male spirit, not a male ghost, not a male animal. He understands and is capable of making physical contact.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.12.pli: hattho nāma kapparaṃ upādāya yāva agganakhā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.12.eng: hand: from the elbow to the tip of the nails.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.13.pli: Etassa asaddhammassa paṭisevanatthāya ubbhakkhakaṃ adhojāṇumaṇḍalaṃ gahaṇaṃ sādiyati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.13.eng: If, for the purpose of indulging in inappropriate sexual conduct, she consents to him holding her above the collar bone or below the knees, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.14.eng: And the edge of her robe:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.15.pli: etassa asaddhammassa paṭisevanatthāya nivatthaṃ vā pārutaṃ vā gahaṇaṃ sādiyati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.15.eng: if, for the purpose of indulging in inappropriate sexual conduct, she consents to him holding her sarong or upper robe, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.17.pli: etassa asaddhammassa paṭisevanatthāya purisassa hatthapāse tiṭṭhati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.17.eng: if, for the purpose of indulging in inappropriate sexual conduct, she stands within arm’s reach of a man, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.19.pli: etassa asaddhammassa paṭisevanatthāya purisassa hatthapāse ṭhitā sallapati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.19.eng: if, for the purpose of indulging in inappropriate sexual conduct, she stands within arm’s reach of a man, chatting with him, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.20.eng: And goes to a rendezvous with him:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.21.pli: etassa asaddhammassa paṭisevanatthāya purisena— “itthannāmaṃ okāsaṃ āgacchā”ti—vuttā gacchati. Pade pade āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.21.eng: if, for the purpose of indulging in inappropriate sexual conduct, she goes to such-and-such a place when told by a man to do so, then for every step, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.22.eng: For entering within arm’s reach of the man, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.23.eng: And consents to him coming to her:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.24.pli: etassa asaddhammassa paṭisevanatthāya purisassa abbhāgamanaṃ sādiyati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.24.eng: if, for the purpose of indulging in inappropriate sexual conduct, she consents to a man coming to her, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.25.eng: When he enters within arm’s reach, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.26.eng: And enters a covered place with him:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.27.pli: etassa asaddhammassa paṭisevanatthāya yena kenaci paṭicchannaṃ okāsaṃ paviṭṭhamatte āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.27.eng: if, for the purpose of indulging in inappropriate sexual conduct, she enters a concealed place with any man, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.28.eng: And disposes her body for him for that purpose:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.29.pli: etassa asaddhammassa paṭisevanatthāya purisassa hatthapāse ṭhitā kāyaṃ upasaṃharati, āpatti thullaccayassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.29.eng: if, for the purpose of indulging in inappropriate sexual conduct, she disposes her body for a man while standing within arm’s reach of him, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.31.eng: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.33.pli: seyyathāpi nāma tālo matthakacchinno abhabbo puna viruḷhiyā evameva bhikkhunī aṭṭhamaṃ vatthuṃ paripūrentī assamaṇī hoti asakyadhītā. Tena vuccati pārājikā hotīti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.33.eng: just as a palm tree with its crown cut off is incapable of further growth, so is a nun who fulfills the eight parts not a monastic, not a daughter of the Sakyan. Therefore it is said “she is expelled.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.33.comm: The Pali actually reads “the eighth part”, rather than “the eight parts”. This, however, does not mean number eight in the list, but the last of the eight to be completed, whichever that is, and thus it implies the fulfillment of all eight.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.35.pli: saṃvāso nāma ekakammaṃ ekuddeso samasikkhatā. Eso saṃvāso nāma.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.35.eng: Community: joint legal procedures, a joint recitation, the same training—this is called “community”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.36.pli: So tāya saddhiṃ natthi. Tena vuccati asaṃvāsāti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.1.36.eng: She does not take part in this—therefore it is called “excluded from the community”.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.2.8.eng: if she is overwhelmed by pain;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.2.9.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.2.10.eng: The eighth offense entailing expulsion is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.2.11.pli: Uddiṭṭhā kho, ayyāyo, aṭṭha pārājikā dhammā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.2.11.eng: “Venerables, the eight rules on expulsion have been recited.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.2.12.pli: Yesaṃ bhikkhunī aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā āpajjitvā na labhati bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ saṃvāsaṃ, yathā pure tathā pacchā, pārājikā hoti asaṃvāsā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.2.12.eng: If a nun commits any one of them, she no longer belongs to the community of nuns. As before, so after, she is expelled and excluded from the community.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.2.13.eng: In regard to this I ask you,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.2.19.eng: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pj8:2.2.20.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion in the Nuns’ Analysis is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:0.4.eng: The subchapter on evenly all around

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:0.5.eng: The training rule on evenly all around

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:0.6.pli: Ime kho panāyyāyo sekhiyā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:0.6.eng: Venerables, these rules to be trained in come up for recitation.

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo puratopi pacchatopi olambentī nivāsenti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.2.eng: the nuns from the group of six wore their sarongs hanging down in front and behind.

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo puratopi pacchatopi olambentī nivāsessanti, seyyathāpi gihiniyo kāmabhoginiyo”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.4.eng: “How can nuns wear their sarongs hanging down in front and behind? They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.5.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.6.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo puratopi pacchatopi olambentī nivāsessantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.7.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six wear their sarongs hanging down in front and behind?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo puratopi pacchatopi olambentī nivāsentī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo puratopi pacchatopi olambentī nivāsessanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.11.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.14.1.eng: ‘“I will wear my sarong evenly all around,” this is how you should train.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.15.eng: One should wear one’s sarong evenly all around, covering the navel and the knees.

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.16.pli: Yā anādariyaṃ paṭicca purato vā pacchato vā olambentī nivāseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.16.eng: If a nun, out of disrespect, wears her sarong hanging down in front or behind, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk1:1.24.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:0.5.eng: the training rule on defecating in water

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo udake uccārampi passāvampi kheḷampi karonti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.2.eng: the nuns from the group of six were defecating, urinating, and spitting in water.

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo udake uccārampi passāvampi kheḷampi karissanti, seyyathāpi gihiniyo kāmabhoginiyo”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.4.eng: “How can nuns defecate, urinate, and spit in water? They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.5.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā, tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.6.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo udake uccārampi passāvampi kheḷampi karissantī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.7.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six defecate, urinate, and spit in water?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.8.pli: Atha kho bhikkhuniyo bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.9.eng: who in turn told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.10.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.12.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo udake uccārampi passāvampi kheḷampi karontī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.12.eng: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.15.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo udake uccārampi passāvampi kheḷampi karissanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.15.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.17.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.17.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.18.1.pli: “Na udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.18.1.eng: ‘“I will not defecate, urinate, or spit in water,” this is how you should train.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.19.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhunīnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:1.19.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena gilānā bhikkhuniyo udake uccārampi passāvampi kheḷampi kātuṃ kukkuccāyanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards, being afraid of wrongdoing, sick nuns did not defecate, urinate, or spit in water.

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.2.eng: They told the Buddha. He then had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.3.pli: anujānāmi, bhikkhave, gilānāya bhikkhuniyā udake uccārampi passāvampi kheḷampi kātuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.3.eng: “Monks, I allow a sick nun to defecate, urinate, and spit in water.

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.4.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.4.eng: And so, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.5.1.pli: “Na udake agilānā uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karissāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.5.1.eng: ‘“When not sick, I will not defecate, urinate, or spit in water,” this is how you should train.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.6.pli: Na udake agilānāya uccāro vā passāvo vā kheḷo vā kātabbo.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.6.eng: If one is not sick, one should not defecate, urinate, or spit in water.

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.7.pli: Yā anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake agilānā uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karoti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.7.eng: If, out of disrespect, a nun who is not sick defecates, urinates, or spits in water, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.13.eng: if she does it on dry ground, but it then spreads to water;

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.17.eng: if she is overwhelmed by pain;

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.18.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.19.eng: The fifteenth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.20.eng: The seventh subchapter on shoes is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.21.eng: “Venerables, the rules to be trained in have been recited.

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.22.eng: In regard to this I ask you,

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.28.eng: You are pure in this and therefore silent. I’ll remember it thus.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-sk75:2.29.eng: The chapter on training is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:0.4.eng: The training rule on taking legal action

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:0.5.pli: Ime kho panāyyāyo sattarasa saṅghādisesā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:0.5.eng: Venerables, these seventeen rules on suspension come up for recitation.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro upāsako bhikkhunisaṅghassa udositaṃ datvā kālaṅkato hoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.2.eng: At that time a lay follower who had given a storehouse to the Sangha of nuns had died.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.4.pli: eko assaddho appasanno, eko saddho pasanno.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.4.eng: one with and one without faith and confidence,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.5.eng: and they divided their father’s property between them.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.6.pli: Atha kho so assaddho appasanno taṃ saddhaṃ pasannaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.6.eng: Then the one without faith said to the other,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.7.eng: “The storehouse is ours; let’s allocate it to one of us.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.8.pli: Evaṃ vutte, so saddho pasanno taṃ assaddhaṃ appasannaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.8.eng: But the one with faith responded,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.10.eng: our father gave it to the Sangha of nuns.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.11.pli: Dutiyampi kho so assaddho appasanno taṃ saddhaṃ pasannaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.11.eng: A second time they both said the same thing,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.13.pli: Atha kho so saddho pasanno taṃ assaddhaṃ appasannaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.16.pli: Tatiyampi kho so assaddho appasanno taṃ saddhaṃ pasannaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.16.eng: and a third time the one without faith repeated his proposal.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.18.eng: The one with faith then thought,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.19.eng: “If I get it, I too would give it to the Sangha of nuns,”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.22.pli: Atha kho so udosito tehi bhājīyamāno tassa assaddhassa appasannassa pāpuṇāti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.22.eng: But when they allocated it, it fell to the one without faith.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.23.pli: Atha kho so assaddho appasanno bhikkhuniyo upasaṅkamitvā etadavoca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.23.eng: He then went to the nuns and said,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.24.eng: “Please leave, Venerables, this storehouse is mine.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.25.pli: Evaṃ vutte thullanandā bhikkhunī taṃ purisaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.25.eng: The nun Thullanandā said to him,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.26.pli: “māyyo, evaṃ avaca, tumhākaṃ pitunā bhikkhunisaṅghassa dinno”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.26.eng: “No, your father gave it to the Sangha of nuns.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.27.eng: Because they were unable to agree, they asked judges to decide on the matter.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.29.eng: “Venerable, who knows that it was given to the Sangha of nuns?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.30.pli: Evaṃ vutte, thullanandā bhikkhunī te mahāmatte etadavoca—

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.31.pli: “api nāyyā tumhehi diṭṭhaṃ vā sutaṃ vā sakkhiṃ ṭhapayitvā dānaṃ diyyamānan”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.31.eng: “But Sirs, didn’t you appoint a witness who saw or heard the giving of the gift?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.33.pli: “saccaṃ kho ayyā āhā”ti taṃ udositaṃ bhikkhunisaṅghassa akaṃsu.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.33.eng: “It’s true what the Venerable says,” the judges made the storehouse the property of the Sangha of nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.34.pli: Atha kho so puriso parājito ujjhāyati khiyyati vipāceti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.34.eng: The defeated man complained and criticized the nuns,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.36.eng: How could they take my storehouse?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.37.eng: Thullanandā told the judges of this

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.39.pli: Atha kho so puriso daṇḍito bhikkhunupassayassa avidūre ājīvakaseyyaṃ kārāpetvā ājīvake uyyojesi—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.39.eng: That man then made a dwelling place for Ājīvaka ascetics not far from the nuns,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.40.eng: inciting them to abuse the nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.41.eng: Once again Thullanandā told the judges

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.43.eng: People then complained and criticized those nuns,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.44.pli: “paṭhamaṃ bhikkhuniyo udositaṃ acchindāpesuṃ, dutiyaṃ daṇḍāpesuṃ, tatiyaṃ bandhāpesuṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.44.eng: “First the nuns take his storehouse, then they have him punished, and then they have him jailed.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.46.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.46.eng: Nuns heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.47.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.47.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.48.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā take legal action?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.49.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.49.eng: Then those nuns told the monks …

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.50.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī ussayavādikā viharatī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.50.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā is taking legal action?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.53.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī ussayavādikā viharissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.53.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā take legal action?

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.55.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.55.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.56.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī ussayavādikā vihareyya gahapatinā vā gahapatiputtena vā dāsena vā kammakārena vā antamaso samaṇaparibbājakenāpi, ayaṃ bhikkhunī paṭhamāpattikaṃ dhammaṃ āpannā nissāraṇīyaṃ saṅghādisesan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:1.56.1.eng: ‘If a nun takes legal action against a householder or a householder’s offspring or a slave or a worker or even toward a monastic or a wanderer, then that nun has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.1.6.eng: what is meant is that she is the initiator of a lawsuit.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.1.8.comm: Agāraṁ is typically rendered as “in a house”. The problem with this is that it is not unallowable for a monastic to live in a building that is the equivalent of a house. What a monastic should not do is own a home and then live there.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.1.10.eng: whoever is an offspring or a sibling.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.1.10.comm: “Offspring” renders putta/ā, whereas “sibling” renders bhātaro. In Pali the male gender takes precedent if a group contains people of both sexes. For instance, the plural puttā, “sons”, may mean “children” or “offsping”, depending on the context. In the same way, the plural bhātāro, “brothers”, can mean “siblings”. This way of understanding male-gender nouns is confirmed in the introduction to the Pali lexical work the Abhidhānappadīpikāṭīkā: Ettha hi mātā ca pitā ca pitaro, putto ca dhītā ca puttā, sassu ca sasuro ca sasurā, bhātā ca bhaginī ca bhātaroti bhinnaliṅgānampi ekaseso dassitoti, “‘Mother and father are fathers; son and daughter are sons; mother-in-law and father-in-law are fathers-in-law; brother and sister are brothers;’ in this case the split gender is shown with only one gender remaining.” The Abhidhānappadīpikāṭīkā is available online at tipitaka.org.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.1.12.eng: one born in the household, one who has been bought, one who has been brought back as a captive.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.1.16.pli: bhikkhuñca bhikkhuniñca sikkhamānañca sāmaṇerañca sāmaṇeriñca ṭhapetvā yo koci paribbājakasamāpanno.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.1.16.eng: anyone who is a wanderer apart from Buddhist monks, nuns, trainee nuns, novice monks, and novice nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.1.17.pli: Aḍḍaṃ karissāmīti dutiyaṃ vā pariyesati gacchati vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.1.17.eng: If, thinking, “I’ll initiate a lawsuit,” she looks for a companion or just goes there herself, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.1.18.eng: If she tells one other person, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.1.19.eng: If she tells a second person, she commits a serious offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.1.20.eng: At the end of the lawsuit, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.1.22.eng: there is an offense as soon as the misconduct is committed, and no pressing is required.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.1.24.eng: she is sent away from the Sangha.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.1.26.pli: saṅghova tassā āpattiyā mānattaṃ deti mūlāya paṭikassati abbheti, na sambahulā na ekā bhikkhunī. Tena vuccati “saṅghādiseso”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.1.26.eng: only the Sangha gives the trial period for that offense, sends back to the beginning, and rehabilitates—not several nuns, not an individual nun. Therefore it is called an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.1.26.comm: For a discussion of the rendering “several” for sambahula, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.1.27.pli: Tasseva āpattinikāyassa nāmakammaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Tenapi vuccati “saṅghādiseso”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.1.27.eng: This is the name and designation of this class of offense. Therefore, too, it is called an offense entailing suspension.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.2.2.eng: if she goes there because people pull her;

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.2.3.eng: if she is asking for protection;

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.2.4.eng: if she tells without specifying a person;

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.2.7.eng: if she is overwhelmed by pain;

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.2.8.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss1:2.2.9.eng: The first offense entailing suspension is finished.
